entries.meaning: A rotating shaft that drives (or is driven by) a crank.

verbs.description: crankshaft (third-person singular simple present crankshafts, present participle crankshafting, simple past and past participle crankshafted)

entries.meaning: (of a straight bolt or rod) To deform in such a manner that part of the rod or bolt is displaced sideways, offset from the longitudinal axis of the part, but remains parallel with the part's main longitudinal axis, with the final shape somewhat resembling a crankshaft.
